About Work

Games

Create lightweight, interactive entertainment that is shareable and easy-to-make

Situation

BuzzFeed content creators wanted to experiment with simple game formats that are fun and shareable. After the breakout success of the quiz format, they are looking for more playful ways to connect with the audiences.

Opportunity

Create a collection of turn-key game formats for mobile and desktop that is easy to make and adapt for different content.

Along with a producer, an illustrator and 4 engineers who also have experienced in buildng games in the past, I led the UX design and collaborated with content creators to explore a wide range of game ideas. Over the course of 12 months, we prototyped 15 formats and published over 60 games. For the most popular games, we also created a game building tool that enables the content creators to generate their own games. Here are some of my favorite formats:

1

Image Randomizer

Randomize image assets or text strings to generate an unexpected result. Try them out:

  • üóØ What word that is best describe you?
  • ü•¶ What vegetarian dinner you can make?
  • ‚ÄçüíÅ What hairstyle you should wear?

2

Typing Trivia

As one of the most requested game formats, we created a typing trivia and a simple CMS for the content creators to create a game on their own by uploading the images and question-answer texts.

3

Name Generator

Inspired by the TV shows like "Orange is the New Black" and "Games of Thrones", the player gets a character-inspired name generated at random as well as a custom artifact to share on Facebook and Twitter.

4

Memory Game

As a coffee shop barista, the player has to remember a series of complex coffee orders and tap the ingredients in the correct sequence. How Long Would You Last As A Barista? got over 380k views.

5

Image Mixer

The player creates a shareable, Pinterest friendly composition by mixing and matching images. The prototype game Can You Pick A Hipster Outfit For Snow White? got over 500k+ views.

6

Slider Randomizer

The player chooses the desired options using a slider to get an fun, unexpected result.

7

20-questions

Based on the classic 20-questions game, Emoji Oracle asks a series of binary yes/no question to guess the emoji you have in mind. Try it yourself!

8

Simple action game

The player controls the avatar to avoid falling objects by tapping the left and right side of the screen. The game is fully customizable from graphic assets, animation speed, to scoring system so it can be adapted for different themes or brands. Try it yourself

Results

With an average of 45% completion rate, many games went on becomes a huge hit. Although our audiences and content creators loved the games, each project required a lot of effort to execute, and our team had a hard time keeping up the demands. Our team struggled to ship high-quality games that were performant on mobile and desktop, and shareable across the social platforms. Our content creators were frustrated that they couldn't experiment ideas on their own at a faster pace.

After 12 months of experimentation phase, the strategy was shifted to scale up a few successful formats by integrating them into BuzzFeed‚Äôs in-house content management system. A few of the game team crews joined the bigger CMS team to integrate those popular formats as part of the publishing workflow.

Role: Product design. Team: 4 engineers, 1 producer and 1 illustrator.
